text:
Standard installation.
When requesting 'http://localhost:8080/index%2Ehtml' instead 
of 'http://localhost:8080/index.html', tomcat returns an 404 error.

3.2.2 works fine.

I came accross this error while creating an interface to Crystal Reports, which 
creates this kind of links.
creator: rmeijsen@heyde.nl
Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
For security reasons, the following *unnecessary* escapes cause the URL to be
considered invalid:

%25 - '%'
%2E - '.'
%2F - '/'
%5C - '\'

For example, allowing these escapes made it very difficult to insure that JSP
source isn't inadvertently served statically, i.e. is index%2Ejsp a JSP page or
a static resource?

This behavior has been implemented in Tomcat 3.2.3, Tomcat 3.3, and Tomcat 4.0.
All will return some form of error, I think either 404 or 403 (forbidden).

If you put Apache in front of Tomcat, you will get one round of decoding
before the URL gets passed to Tomcat.  Perhaps that will allow Crystal Reports
to work.  I'm not sure about other web servers.

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
